title: Riocasino
author: Riocasino
created_time: December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PMLast edit: December 27, 2022, 08:49:57 AM by Riocasino
content: I genuenly wanted to buy hist script because Punt look lit. like Stake.com and these kind of casinos are ready to rock and roll.But this  guy possibly just photoshop the website and try to sell script like he has the whole code.1. When I ask him to send demo (live link) he refused with copyright excuses. 2. He also told me ridiculous  thing that he has 100% refund policy if something go wrong (When he accepts only Bitcoin)here proof of our conversation:https://www.loom.com/share/e6051cfa91844425bf3943ae45878d9b it lead me to believe that this guy is most likely a scammer.link to his profle;https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3497638

comments.author: erickbtc
comments.body: As you can see there is a format to be able to post in this forum, otherwise and as is evident you only make imaginary accusations according to your reasoning. Post properly and you will be considered.Code:[b][color=black]What happened:: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Scammers Profile Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Reference Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Amount Scammed: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Payment Method: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Proof of Payment: [/color][/b][b][color=black]PM/Chat Logs: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Additional Notes: [/color][/b]There I leave the format.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: erickbtc on December 23, 2022, 11:44:06 PMAs you can see there is a format to be able to post in this forum, otherwise and as is evident you only make imaginary accusations according to your reasoning. Post properly and you will be considered.Code:[b][color=black]What happened:: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Scammers Profile Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Reference Link: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Amount Scammed: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Payment Method: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Proof of Payment: [/color][/b][b][color=black]PM/Chat Logs: [/color][/b][b][color=black]Additional Notes: [/color][/b]There I leave the format.I consider the pieces of evidence unless the seller comes down here to refute it, when it comes to script there should be a demo the seller should provide the username and password where the potential buyer can log in and check the panel, the dashboard and what's on it unless the seller already has a good reputation and testimonials from real buyers and he agreed to escrow the funds or it's a third-party marketplace like CodeCanyon, but I don't see these requirements on the seller.We have a saying that an ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure if there is evidence of potential scamming we have to reconsider it and ask the accuser to defend themselves, we have seen it on other threads.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: Riocasino on December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PM1. When I ask him to send demo (live link) he refused with copyright excuses. This is definitely unusual. When he hand over the source code or binary to the buyer, there's always chance it'll leaked either due to hack or intentionally leaked by buyer.Quote from: Riocasino on December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PM2. He also told me ridiculous  thing that he has 100% refund policy if something go wrong (When he accepts only Bitcoin)It's not ridiculous, usually it means the seller would send the money back to you manually. Although it's obvious you have to trust the seller.Quote from: Riocasino on December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PMlink to his profle;https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3497638I checked his thread and found out his software rely on end of life software. Update for Node.js version 10.x has been ended at 2021-04-30.Quote from: simmonson on November 25, 2022, 04:15:42 AMRequirements-OS: Linux or Windows (+SSH Access or terminal in windows).-HDD Space: You have 2 Options:-Using API Need 1 GB.-Using BTC Full Node Need 300 GB.-Node: v10x.-NPM: v6x.-Apache.-SSL.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Send him a PM with this thread link, and if he does not respond, it is better to leave a warning in his trust regarding these practices.Unfortunately, so far, no scam has occurred, but the indications strongly indicate that he is a fraud, and therefore I think that giving negative trust is due if he fails to answer the allegations in this topic.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: Riocasino on December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PMBut this  guy possibly just photoshop the website and try to sell script like he has the whole code.~Snipped~here proof of our conversation:https://www.loom.com/share/e6051cfa91844425bf3943ae45878d9bI haven't checked all of the scripts on that website, but the one you were looking to buy [archived link] is called "Betify" and apparently it was made by "Royal Design Studio [archive of their website - archive of their dribbble page]" but for some reason, all of their pages are gone [except for their Telegram (you could try asking for a demo in there, but I prefer not to vouch)]... It's worth noting that the seller in question, took multiple screenshots from the video link that I shared earlier [refer to the Betify part] and changed its name to "BET" instead!

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on December 26, 2022, 01:57:43 PMQuote from: Riocasino on December 23, 2022, 11:05:12 PMBut this  guy possibly just photoshop the website and try to sell script like he has the whole code.~Snipped~here proof of our conversation:https://www.loom.com/share/e6051cfa91844425bf3943ae45878d9bI haven't checked all of the scripts on that website, but the one you were looking to buy [archived link] is called "Betify" and apparently it was made by "Royal Design Studio [archive of their website - archive of their dribbble page]" but for some reason, all of their pages are gone [except for their Telegram (you could try asking for a demo in there, but I prefer not to vouch)]... It's worth noting that the seller in question, took multiple screenshots from the video link that I shared earlier [refer to the Betify part] and changed its name to "BET" instead!There's really no script to check all the seller has are screenshots and descriptions of the casino platforms that he claims to own, if you check all the other marketplaces they provide a working demo to satisfy their potential clients, you don't buy a car based on the description you have to ride with it first and check all the features if everything is all there, if they don't want the demo posted in public at least they can do this in private conversation but they don't have these in their offer.The guy could be a bogus seller so buy with extreme cautions.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on December 26, 2022, 11:45:35 PMThere's really no script to check all the seller has are screenshots~Snipped~I agree... That's also what I said in the latter part of my previous post and in case my post wasn't clear enough [my bad for mentioning my point in an inexplicit manner], I pointed to where alterations were made by that seller.BTW, I forgot to tag that account yesterday [it's tagged now].

It's worth noting that the seller in question, took multiple screenshots from the video link that I shared earlier [refer to the Betify part] and changed its name to "BET" instead!There's really no script to check all the seller has are screenshots and descriptions of the casino platforms that he claims to own, if you check all the other marketplaces they provide a working demo to satisfy their potential clients, you don't buy a car based on the description you have to ride with it first and check all the features if everything is all there, if they don't want the demo posted in public at least they can do this in private conversation but they don't have these in their offer.The guy could be a bogus seller so buy with extreme cautions.intersting how you find it. dribble is a site to find web designers not developers. beitify is a design only they use only fronted html, css, jquiry, figma  to make it  not complete backened casino (lareval , php etc= the designer you sent here is very talented they also made another casino https://dribbble.com/shots/18760107-CryptoBet-Casinobut she is only web designer and fronter developer.to make a complete casinos is a whole different story and has huge costs  there is a lot of backened work that need to be done. months of works. like i said this guy most likely just photoshop the design from there and try to sell it as he has backened code.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: you should include the thread link(s) in the post, I could not find it until I went to his profile. After reading his posts, it is very likely it is a scam. Most casinos are built in a very complex way and it is extremely unlikely that someone will be able to replicate the software successfully and securely. Even if they did, it would be worth a fortune. I could not load the loom video, but if he was not able to provide live demo or not willing to use an escrow for the transaction, then these are also red flags.
